intro: Scabiosa velenovskiana, commonly known as the Velenovský's scabious, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the family Caprifoliaceae and is characterized by its clusters of small, pink or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It has hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves, and it is often found in alpine or mountainous regions. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native habitat.
